name: Black Spot
symptoms: Black, round spots that form on the upper sides of leaves. Lower leaves are usually infected first.
treatment: Disinfect your pruners with a household disinfectant after every use. Remove dead leaves and infected canes from around the plants and disguard in the trash. Do not add to the compost pile.
supplements: Keep your plants healthy by providing regular feedings of organic fertilizer.

name: Powdery Mildew
symptoms: Infected plants will display a white powdery substance that is most visible on upper leaf surfaces
treatment: Trim and remove infected plant parts. Do not till the debris into the soil or use in the compost pile.
supplements: Keep your plants healthy by providing regular feedings of organic fertilizer.

name: Downy Mildew
symptoms: White powdery substance on the upper leaves.
treatment: Downy mildew needs water to survive and spread.  It there is no water on your leaves, the disease cannot spread. Keep water off leaves as much as possible.
supplements: Keep plants healthy by planting in healthy soils and maintaining nutritional requirements.

name: Canker
symptoms: Symptoms may include sunken, swollen, cracked or dead areas found on stems, limbs or trunk.
treatment: Remove diseased parts in dry weather. Avoid overwatering and overcrowding; avoid mechanical wounds such as damage from lawn mowers.
supplements: Keep plants healthy by planting in healthy soils and maintaining nutritional requirements.
